title: PSA: DO NOT DECLARE WHAT CHAMPION YOU WANT TO PLAY

replies.body: So, you're censoring "fucking" but then go out and say bullshit. Hrm.
i just have like 5 different picks for whatever role i get so it doesn't rly affect me tbh
There has been a LOT of trolling and debauchery today. It makes me sad.

> [{quoted}](name=Elias1724,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=gRHfzcqQ,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2016-01-16T16:34:30.120+0000)
>
> PSA don't declare what champ you want to play so your team has 0 chance to create a decent comp or pick characters who you are playing for the 3% of trolls in the game.

Honestly we went by fine for 5 seasons without showing off what champion we intended to pick.

I don't necessarily want you to build a team comp around my Janna or Sona pick. I'll pick them if I think they fit nicely with our team and against theirs. I also don't want to be "forced" to play Sona because I showed her but they just picked a bot lane I don't want to pick her into and have 4 people yell "wtf" when I opt for someone else because the match up doesn't work.
"We were honestly fine building the pyramids without wheels. They're not important."

> [{quoted}](name=Menea Calais,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=gRHfzcqQ,comment-id=000200000000,timestamp=2016-01-16T17:33:44.558+0000)
>
> "We were honestly fine building the pyramids without wheels. They're not important."

Honestly outside of high elo or a Yasuo comp there's no need to wrap your team comp against a specific champion/player, people are better off playing their best champ for their role with little to no regards to synergy.

I also feel like pick intent is going to create awkward "wtf wow troll said he would Thresh but he went for Fiddle" moments if you happen to "intent" to pick a champion and finally opt for another for whatever reason.
It's mostly for "hey, this guy wants to play Mundo. Let's see if we can FP him. Ok, we can. Let's not ban him."

> [{quoted}](name=Menea Calais,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=gRHfzcqQ,comment-id=00020000000000000000,timestamp=2016-01-16T18:12:45.793+0000)
>
> It's mostly for "hey, this guy wants to play Mundo. Let's see if we can FP him. Ok, we can. Let's not ban him."

If they wanted to enforce that then we'd be able to pick champs we don't own to trade.

The problem with that is when people change their mind. How do remedy that? Force them to trade? What if they legitimately think that that's a bad idea due to match up? Plus, Riot would have to make UI elements for this.

It's easier, clearly, and less logistically complicated if you're required to own champions to trade them. It also gives you a monetary incentive to own champions beyond simply using them.

> [{quoted}](name=Menea Calais,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=gRHfzcqQ,comment-id=0002000000000000000000010000,timestamp=2016-01-16T21:06:22.447+0000)
>
> The problem with that is when people change their mind. How do remedy that? Force them to trade? What if they legitimately think that that's a bad idea due to match up? 

Implying this can't happen if you pick a champion you own (but don't play) for a lower pick teammate.

Um, it can't happen right now. If this occurs live, the champion is still picked, and the game continues.
If the suggestion is that you can trade without owning the champion, how are you able to play a champion that is unavailable for you to play?
